page.title: 05AIRFIELD ATTENDANT
page.content: Mr. Lennie has worked 18 years for Loganair. His duties are to attend the fire-tender. He arrives in a tractor to pull the fire-tender when there is an emergency. He goes up to the airfield only for scheduled flights. When there is an ambulance flight he only needs to go at night. He is paid for every plane that lands. He has one assistant who helps him with weighing the luggage and logging it. Each flight is also logged. He spends about 1 hour at the airfield, but when there is fog he may have to stay 4 or 5 hours. Mr. Lennie has had one emergency. On June 1st, 1984, one of the planes crashed into a potato field not far from the airfield. The fire-tender was taken to where the plane crashed, but wasn't needed. No-one was injured but the plane was a write-off.
